opendapr 0.1.0

    • 1. Simple workflow : Download and import data for a given region of interest and time frame
    • 2. Advanced use of `get_url()`

Get informations related to the variables available for a given collection

Source: R/get_variables_info.R
get_variables_info.Rd

Get the variables available for a given collection

get_variables_info(collection, credentials = NULL)

Arguments

collection

string. mandatory. Collection of interest (see details of get_url).
credentials

vector string of length 2 with username and password. optional.

Value

A data.frame with the available variables for the collection, and a set of related information for each variable. The variables marked as "extractable" in the column "extractable_w_opendapr" can be provided as input parameter variables of the function get_url

Examples



# login to Earthdata
log <- login(c(Sys.getenv("earthdata_un"),Sys.getenv("earthdata_pw")),source="earthdata")
#> Checking credentials...
#> Successfull login to earthdata 

# Get the variables available for the collection MOD11A1.006
(df_varinfo <- get_variables_info("MOD11A1.006"))
